title: 112_hr4373
content: The Act may be cited as the "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" and includes expanded tax benefits for adoption made permanent. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" includes permanent expansions for adoption tax benefits. This includes an increase in the dollar limitation for the adoption credit from $10,000 to $13,170. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" increases the adoption credit for a child with special needs from $10,000 to $13,170. The inflation adjustment for dollar limitations in the tax code is amended to increase certain dollar amounts for taxable years starting after December 31, 2010. The dollar amounts in the tax code are adjusted for inflation for taxable years starting after December 31, 2010. For taxable years beginning after December 31, 2002, the income limitation amount is increased by a specific calculation. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The tax code adjusts dollar amounts for inflation for taxable years after December 31, 2010. The income limitation amount is increased by a specific calculation for taxable years after December 31, 2002, and rounded to the nearest multiple of $10 if not already. Adoption assistance programs are also covered under this provision. The tax code adjusts dollar amounts for inflation, increasing the income limitation amount to $13,170 for adoption assistance programs. The income limitation amount for adoption assistance programs is increased to $13,170 from $10,000 to adjust for inflation. Beginning after December 31, 2010, dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) will be increased by a cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. "Income limitation for taxable years after December 31, 2002, will be increased by a cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year, rounded to the nearest multiple of $10." The income limitation for taxable years after December 31, 2002, will be increased by a cost-of-living adjustment rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Additionally, a credit is made refundable by amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to make a credit refundable and to include conforming amendments to various sections. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to make changes to various sections, including striking specific references to section 23 and inserting references to section 25D. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking specific references to section 23 and inserting references to section 25D, as well as making changes to sections 36C and 137. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by updating references from section 23 to section 36C in various sections such as 904(i), 1016(a)(26), 1400C(d), and 6211(b)(4)(A). The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by updating references from section 23 to section 36C in various sections. Amendments include inserting "36C," before "53(e)" in section 6211(b)(4)(A) and striking the item relating to section 23 in the table of sections for subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by updating references to section 36C in various sections. The table of sections for subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by inserting a new item after section 36B. The amendments made by this subsection to adoption expenses coordinate with the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act and the Tax Relief Act of 2010. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 2011.
